title: Standardization for Logistics Interoperability
segmentation: I would like to thank organizers of this conference for inviting GS, one to present here and address you.
Thank you, I also would like to think Yucca Foxby, who was speaking before and also young Torah forgiven introduction to GS one.
Also, Stephen Mills, thank you to you as well so it I'm not coming as completely strangers here.
Thank you.
So basically I would like to explain about briefly about GS one.
Who we are about our activities in transport and logistics, and in particular about logistics interoperability model.
So first of all GS one.
We are not for profit organization.
Our vision is a world where the goods and related information are moving efficiently and effectively for the benefit of businesses.

So we see our mission as being a neutral leader who enables communities to specify their requirements towards standards development and work together to develop the standards and help implementation of the standards.
We are a global organization and and we are dedicated to design and implementation of the standards with objective to improve efficiency globally in the supply chains.
So in a nutshell.
Are we are fully integrated global organization.
We have been created more than 30 years ago and in some countries we were known in the US.
We were known as a UCC in Europe.
The organization was more known as Ian European article numbering and in 2005 we changed the name into GS One and this name was used and is used in all organizations.
All over the world.

So now we have 108 local member organizations, so local representations of the GS one and the objective is really to have a local support in local language to any company who would like to become a member and to use the standards we have more than 1.3 million companies, core members of GS one and who apply standards in their everyday life.
End user standards today.
Our key beliefs, and I think that's really important.
To reiterate, we are not for profit organization.
We are neutral from any business parties.

If you create a platform for any company was it is big multinational or small medium enterprise to get together to express the requirements towards a standard development and to participate in developments of the standards.
We work in more than 20 sectors.
The key sector in which we developed is retail sector.

Also now healthcare sector is one of the key sectors of GS1 as well as transport, logistics and customs and under discussion new sectors such as aerospace and defense, automotive, financial services and some.
I think really the the importance and the added value of the GS line as an organization as and as a standards is that we have a unique integrated framework which any campaign was.
It is a small ask me or big multinational can take and start applying straight ahead.
So it is an underlying level of identification keys, so this is a way of encoding was it is an item, was it is a logistics unit?
Was it is a location, a party?
And it is a specific set of this identifiers.
On which based four pillars of bar codes.
So the way of encoding this information in the back coded format E. COM which is business to business communication that companies can use an exchange data between each other.
GDS sandwiches global data synchronization network that allows companies to have their data synchronized.
For example, the data between manufacturer and retailer or logistic service provider and logistic service client.
So to ensure that when the date is changed on one side, it is synchronized and it's the same update on another in another party.
And last but not least is EPC part sbcglobal of which is stand a global standards for RFID based applications.
Uh so early.
Have as I mentioned earlier, we have a sector dedicated to transport logistics and customs.
In the way that developed we had different activities.
We had another separate group which was focusing on EPC RFID for TLS sector as well and this group contributed to standard developments specifically for the Transport logistics service providers.
This group also run three pilot projects on different geographies.
First project was Intra Asia, second was between Asia and the US and the third phase was from Asia to Europe, in particularly to the Netherlands.
And in this thought phase customs from Netherlands were observer of this of this pilot project.
Also in the same area, GS1 works with the WTO and the local customs administrations in the number of countries.
And we also contribute to international standard developments as a standards organization.
Will work with other standards organizations to ensure that standard developments aligned and we do not create standards which are diverging.
So to summarize, all of these different activities as of this year have been integrated into one.
Transport and logistics industry user group.
And that's that's the scope of our work.
Today as as you presented earlier, we do not only work on the development of the standards, but we also invest in the communication about existing standards.
We have developed a publication about the business cases of the companies who are using the standards today and also about the benefits which this company sees in using this standards.

The first example that was younger explained to everybody very much in details is a business case between Yuna Lever in DHL and other keys refers to the empty miles from Avix, which is US based organization.
We have also examples from Germany, Sweden and I will not be going in the details, but this business cases and publications are available from what I understand from Mary value from the E Freight.
Boost so you can get some of these publications there.
Or if you would have any questions, you can either ask myself, I will send you the copy or direct you to the to the link where this information can be downloaded.
So speaking more about logistics interoperability model.
We got the requirements from our end users from our companies that interoperability is a key requirement.

Now that we need to address this and to work together on this visibility and interoperability in transportation and warehousing, these are the goals which have been well sought by the companies and the group was created to work on the limb project.

So together collaboratively we developed the limb model which details what are the business processes happening in the transportation and warehousing, and also in the elements preceding this, so such as master data alignment and going to the completion such as financial settlement.
One, this business process model was developed, then we looked at what are the related data communication into changes required required to cater for this business process is.
So the link is based on the best practice and the end process is crossing boundaries of the enterprises.
It is based on the interchange standard for information and it is based as.
As we said earlier, on the identification keys such as GTA in for identifying items such as Ssec GCN.
It's another key for identification of shipments.
And on the, uh, ecom communication standards on income and XML.
Delim is intended to scale to any company of any size.
SMEs and multinational enterprises.
And it is collaborative approach around the key players around their logistics service providers and logistics service clients who are buying services from the logistics companies.
What was also very important that we that we included in this activity is that Lincoln Support Division for Sustainable Transportation, which is taking more and more priority in our lives today's.
And we also identified that Lim provides additional a possibility for the scalability to all parties.
So if you can.
The cover look, so the scoop of flame.
Um, in terms of the transportation we were looking at, the continental transport.
So basically it covers for now the current scope, only Rd transportation.
Um, we have as we said, master data alignment than planning conditions, then planning actual execution which includes transportation and warehousing and financial settlement.

If you collaborate with you and see fact we have a dedicated person who works in TG3, which is Transportation Group was in UNC fact, and we also have the participant from UNC Fact who's permanent member of our lean group.
So in this way, we ensure that all developments are aligned.
And and and and any.
Any changes are taken, taken up.
As we said, if you work, the work is based on the GS 1E message standards and we take extensive use of the logistics labels recommendation.
Just looking at Georgia will give me a sign for the time.
I'm good.
That's that's a more deep dive in the logistics model.
I will not bring in you.
I will not bring you through all of it details lines, but I would like to show you it's really that this model has seven distinct chapters.
It starts from Inter operation agreement, gain into master data alignment, then has logistic service conditions and planning.
Then on the right side you have actual execution parts, transportation and warehousing and it finishes with financial settlements and as you see for.
Each of these chapters, we identified the specific elements.
Required this report is about 100 pages report which is available now and basically, which provides a foundation for further standards developments.
Here you will see the group identified the key priority and and the key areas on which we started our work.
Actually went into operational part, so we started the work on transportation and this was identified as as a key requirements from the end users.
So if you have developed already broad which is business requirement analysis document for transport management which defines the requirements for what has to be developed.
Now we are working on the technical specification for the messages.
And according to the planning in the first quarter of 2011, we will start already better versions piloting of the messages of Yuna Lever and the another two material suppliers.
We also have negotiations with the Swedish companies also to have a pilot tests at the same time, but I did not put it on the slides as we did not get a confirmation of the exact companies yet.
The next priority, it will be the warehousing part, so after transportation we will start.
We will complete the development of broad for the warehousing which is already ongoing and the next in line is is planning part.

Of course, the intention I mean, once this the messages are developed is to do the piloting with consecutive implementation and rollout of the messages and of the standards in the companies and implementation guidelines will be developed.
The start of this guidelines will coincide with the pilot in.
And hopefully when the first implementation guidelines will be completed, the companies can start and start deployment of this messages.
So as we will speak in the billing one the little one is already developed.

The model is developed and at the same time as we work now on the development of the messages View, V understand that we need to include other scope and to brood in this group so the outlook to develop Lynn version Two was already announced on the completion of 1st version of Limb.
The intent to increase the scope with other modes of transportation, such as maritime air and rail.
The exact sequence or one this scoops.
When this transport modes will be included, it is still to be agreed with participants, but that's what we have in mind.

And we also want to include a custom spot or or cross border transactions and also requirements towards customs administrations and other participating governmental agencies which stand on the on the cross border such as quarantine and other other inspections.

As I mentioned earlier, to have another group EP, We had a separate group EPC TLS group, but what we would like to do in the second phase is to include the EPC RFID requirements in this in this group.
And also to get a deeper, deeper understanding and better leverage from the GS1 Logistics label.
Recommendations in this in this work.
As a younger person was presented earlier already in in the development of the limb one, we started collaboration with afraid of Project.
And we know that the scope of effort already covers broader transportation modes and we would like to leverage this collaboration further and to enhance our working together.
We already have input and every team participates and provides their input in the broad for the transport part and for their warehousing part.
We're looking for strengthening our collaboration, also for the implementation guidelines and also for the business cases.
We realized that our collaboration.
We should be aimed and we hope that it will bring a win win.
Collaboration for both parties.
And we appreciate the input and the knowledge from our stakeholders and in particularly from the free team.
We understand that there is there is no possibility as yet or it was mentioned earlier referring to the US Department of Transportation.

I think it is probably would be impossible to engage all parties to work on interoperability, but what we want to say is it is important to engage as many parties for working in this area to collaborate and to develop interoperable systems.
And I think the intention of.

Our session today is to ensure that where this operations and projects and activities are ongoing in this areas, we need to strengthen communication and to ensure that what we developed is aligned and that we collaborate and that we create the solution which can be interoperable and work together.
OK, I don't think.
With this I will finish and if you have any questions, think we will take them later on.
Thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you.
